User Story: As a user, I want to create a new world by describing it in my own words so I can quickly set up a custom narrative setting.
Acceptance Criteria:
The system accepts and processes a freeform text description of a fictional world
The system guides the user through a step-by-step world creation process
The user can enter basic world information including name, description, and genre
Form validation ensures required information is provided
Created worlds are saved to the system for future use
Technical Requirements: The system must provide an interface for users to create new worlds using freeform text descriptions. It must guide users through a structured creation process while capturing essential world information. The system must validate user inputs and save created worlds for future use.
Implementation Considerations: Consider the balance between structure and freedom in the world creation process. Think about what information is essential for world creation versus what can be added later. The interface should make world creation approachable for users without requiring game design expertise.

User Story: As a user, I want AI to suggest appropriate attributes and skills based on my world description so I don't have to design everything from scratch.
Acceptance Criteria:
The AI Service analyzes the provided world description
The system suggests appropriate attributes and skills based on the analysis
The user receives clear feedback during AI processing
AI suggestions include appropriate names and descriptions for attributes and skills
Suggestions are contextually relevant to the described world
Technical Requirements: The system must leverage AI capabilities to analyze user-provided world descriptions and suggest appropriate attributes and skills. It must present these suggestions in a usable format and provide clear feedback during processing. Suggestions must include names and descriptions that are contextually relevant to the described world.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to structure AI prompts to generate the most relevant attribute and skill suggestions. Think about the appropriate level of detail for suggestions and how they should be presented to users. The system should handle AI processing delays gracefully with informative feedback.

User Story: As a user, I want to select a pre-defined template to quickly set up a world if I don't want to create my own.
Acceptance Criteria:
Pre-defined templates for Western, Sitcom, and Fantasy genres are available
Templates include complete sets of appropriate attributes and skills
Users can select and customize a template as an alternative to AI-assisted creation
Selected templates pre-populate all required world configuration fields
Template selections are clearly presented as options during world creation
Technical Requirements: The system must provide pre-defined world templates for common genres. These templates must include complete sets of appropriate attributes and skills. The system must allow users to select and customize these templates as an alternative to AI-assisted creation. Selected templates must pre-populate all required configuration fields.
Implementation Considerations: Consider what genres would be most useful to provide as templates for users. Think about how to present templates in an appealing way that communicates their themes. The template system should provide a good starting point while still encouraging customization.

User Story: As a user, I want to review and modify AI-suggested attributes for my world so I can customize them to my preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
The UI displays AI-suggested attributes clearly
Users can approve, modify, or reject each suggested attribute
Modified attributes are immediately updated in the UI
Changes persist between wizard steps
The interface provides clear feedback on user actions
Technical Requirements: The system must display AI-suggested attributes in a clear, reviewable format. It must allow users to approve, modify, or reject individual attribute suggestions. The system must update the UI immediately when attributes are modified and persist these changes between steps of the creation process.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to present attribute suggestions in a way that balances comprehensiveness with usability. Think about what modifications users are most likely to make to suggestions and how to make those edits intuitive. The interface should provide clear feedback on what's been approved, modified, or rejected.

User Story: As a user, I want to define custom attributes for my world so characters can have appropriate traits.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can add new custom attributes beyond AI suggestions
The system enforces the MVP limit of 6 total attributes
Each attribute requires a name and description
Duplicate attribute names are prevented through validation
Custom attributes are saved with the world configuration"
Technical Requirements: The system must allow users to define their own custom attributes beyond AI suggestions. It must enforce the MVP limit of 6 total attributes while requiring essential information for each attribute. The system must validate inputs to prevent duplicates and save custom attributes with the world configuration.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to guide users in creating meaningful attributes without overwhelming them with options. Think about the appropriate constraints on attribute creation to ensure gameplay balance. The interface should make it clear how many attributes can still be added within the limit.
